title: Just had a 1 hour 32 minute game
body: Just had a 1 hour 32 minute game, we lost - the enemy team had the advantage the whole game but it was pretty epic. No one afk'd and there were honors all round afterwards. Good to see such sportsman like conduct and no toxicity. It was a normal, the other team won by getting baron catching someone out and pushing for the win.

replies.body:
This is one of those things I am personally a bit... irrationally angry about. I absolutely detest this type of long game. In my mind it shows a clear lack of understanding of how to play the game, how to press an advantage and win a game.

I mean over 1 hour? come on, if either team comes out on top of a team fight, it should be over, they push and win. What are even the respawn timers at 90 minutes+? jesus.

Only gone over the hour mark twice, longest about 68 minutes i think. It was indeed an epic game, both teams were about as equal as you could make it. I love those games, makes the risk of making a mistake that much higher, it really is a lot of fun!

i had a  80 something minute game as ekko support (built tank/support items) back when ekko was released in all his unerfed glory the game came down to vision control neither team could siege that well, the enemy fizz managed to get a blind five man fish when we were death bushing but his team was slow to react and we ended up having a team fight to end all team fights
AWESOME! I love those games. They are always so intense. My longest game so far is 71 minutes.
2 hours is still my longest, I ended up being a Teemo with 6 rabbadons  and like 1200ap (before they nerfed it). Team wouldn't just group and end -.-
